com.defano.jmonet.tools.base

Class AbstractTransformTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.PaintTool
      • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.AbstractSelectionTool
        • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.AbstractTransformTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanvasCommitObserver, SurfaceInteractionObserver, StaticTransformer, MarchingAntsObserver, KeyListener, EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PerspectiveTool, ProjectionTool, RubberSheetTool, ScaleTool, SlantTool

    public abstract class AbstractTransformTool
extends AbstractSelectionTool
    Mouse and keyboard handler for tools that define a bounding box with flexible corners that can be dragged into a desired position and shape.

        public void pickupSelection()
        Not supported on transform tools. Has no effect when invoked.
        Overrides:
        pickupSelection in class AbstractSelectionTool

      • createSelection

        public void createSelection(Rectangle bounds)
        Creates a selection bounded by the given rectangle. Equivalent to the user clicking and dragging from the top- left to the bottom-right of bounds.
        Overrides:
        createSelection in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        bounds - The selection rectangle to create.

      • createSelection

        public void createSelection(BufferedImage image,
                            Point location)
        Creates a selection containing the given image at the requested location on the canvas.
        Overrides:
        createSelection in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        image - The image contained by the selection. Note that the selection bounds will equal the bounds of this image.
        location - The location on the canvas where the selection (and image) will initially appear.

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e,
                         Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when a mouse button is pressed on a component and then dragged. MOUSE_DRAGGED events will continue to be delivered to the component where the drag originated until the mouse button is released (regardless of whether the mouse position is within the bounds of the component).

        Due to platform-dependent Drag&Drop implementations, MOUSE_DRAGGED events may not be delivered during a native Drag&Drop operation.

        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Overrides:
        mouseDragged in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occured

      • mouseReleased

        Invoked when a mouse button has been released on a component.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

        Parameters:

        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occured

      • addSelectionPoint

        protected void addSelectionPoint(Point initialPoint,
                                 Point newPoint,
                                 boolean isShiftKeyDown)
        Invoked to indicate that the user has defined a new point on the selection path.
        Specified by:
        addSelectionPoint in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        initialPoint - The first point defined by the user (i.e., where the mouse was initially pressed)
        newPoint - A new point to append to the selection path (i.e., where the mouse is now)
        isShiftKeyDown - When true, indicates user is holding the shift key down

      • completeSelection

        protected void completeSelection(Point finalPoint)
        Invoked to indicate that the given point should be considered the last point in the selection path.
        Specified by:
        completeSelection in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        finalPoint - The final point on the selection path.

      • resetSelection

        protected void resetSelection()
        Reset the selection boundary to its initial, no-selection state. AbstractSelectionTool.getSelectionOutline() should return null following a selection reset, but prior to defining a new selection via AbstractSelectionTool.addSelectionPoint(Point, Point, boolean)
        Specified by:
        resetSelection in class AbstractSelectionTool

      • setSelectionBounds

        protected void setSelectionBounds(Rectangle bounds)
        Invoked to indicate the bounds of the selection has changed as the result of a static transformation being applied.
        Specified by:
        setSelectionBounds in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        bounds - The new selection bounds.

        The selection outline

      • adjustSelectionBounds

        protected void adjustSelectionBounds(int xDelta,
                                     int yDelta)
        Invoked to indicate that the selection has moved on the canvas. The selection shape's coordinates should be translated by the given amount.
        Specified by:
        adjustSelectionBounds in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        xDelta - Number of pixels to move horizontally.
        yDelta - Number of pixels to move vertically.
